717431f-b.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 38th Street
717431f-b.text:
(1)
Hotel Normandie just before its demolition, Broadway at S.E.
corner of 38th Street.
December 21, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The Lefcourt-Normandie Building on the site of the Hotel
Normandie, seen from the roof of the Metropolitan Opera House across
the clearing on the N.E. corner, where the Knickerbocker Theatre
has just been demolished.
March 26, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717429f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 38th Street (West)
717429f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, at W. 38th Street, as viewed south-
eastward from the 21 storied Times Square Trust Company Suild-
ing at the N.E. corner of Seventh Avenue and 4Oth Street.
Shown is the excavation for the 35 storied Nnickerbocker-
Caaieo Building at the N.E. corner. Across same apoears the
towered 76 story structure (No. 1N84-8 Broadway) on the former
site of the Hotel Normandie. To the extreme left is the 33 story
Bricken-Casino Building at the S.E. corner of 39th Street.
The low roof tops seen in the center foreground are atop the
Metropolitan Opera House. Note in the baclground the indistirct
outline of the New York Life Insurance 6ompany Building.
May 10, 1930.
P.L. Sperr  N26 288S
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
An earlier view of thhe same area prior to the erection of the
Bricken-Casiro (extreme left of No. 1) andd the demolttior for tk-
Ehnickerbocker Casino. This view is from the onposite side of Seventh
Avenue ard shows on the left margin the photographers vantage for
the later Siew.
February 4, 1929.
P.L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717435f-a.text:

the excavation on the site of the Knickerbocker and Casino theatres.
March 10, 1930.

712500f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street (West) - Broadway
712500f-a.text:
144-156 West 38th Street, south side, from west of Broadway to the
corner of Seventh Avenue.
May 31, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717449f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 38th Street
717449f.text:
Broadway, est side, from 39th to 38th Streets. vt the
extreme left is the LefcourtManhattan Building. In the centre
are the Bricken-Casino and the Kniokerbocker buildings, on the
site of the Casino and Knickerbocker theatres. at the extreme
right is the Lefcourt-Normandie Building,on the site of the old
Hotel Normandie.
1931.
Wurts Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
NE32829

717438f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 38th Street
717438f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, north from and including 38th Street.
In the centre background, from 39th to 40th Streets, is the Metropolitan
Opera House. Beyond the Metropolitan is the twelve-story Emerson
Building, and beyond that is the 33-story Bricken-Textile Building.
Above this is the Times Building, and in the distance is the Hotel
Astor.
July 10, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717430f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 38th Street (West)
717430f-a.text:
1385-1391 Broadway, at the S.W. corner of West 38th Street. Struoture
shown, is the 23-story Bricken-B'way Building. Adjoining same and partially
shown, is the Lefcourt State Building.
May 7, 1930.
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717432f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 38th Street
717432f-a.text:
The Knickerbocker Theatre, Broadway at the N.E. corner of
38th Street, shortly before its demolition..
August 18, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717433f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 38th Street
717433f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, from 40th to 38th Streets. The Lefcourt-
Manhattan Building is in the centre, and at the right is the clearing
on the site of the Casino and Knickerbocker Theatres.
May 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717434f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 38th Street
717434f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, from 40th to 38th Streets, with the
Metropolitan Opera House, badly in need of a bath, in the ce
January 29, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
